abstract: Study in journal PLoS Neglected Tropical Diseases reports scientists working with Predict Project, surveillance program sponsored by United States Agency for International Development, have developed way to obtain oral samples from monkeys by dipping ropes in jam or baby food; pathogens samples left on ropes are useful in predicting potential spread of disease to humans.
lead_paragraph: Scientists developed a simple way to get oral samples from the often wily primates: ropes dipped in strawberry jam or banana baby food.

headline.main: A Sweet Treat Is a Clever Trick in Gauging Monkeys’ Health
headline.print_headline: Sweet Treat a Clever to Test Monkeys’ Health

snippet: Scientists developed a simple way to get oral samples from the often wily primates: ropes dipped in strawberry jam or banana baby food.
